page.title: 04The Nature Reserve.
page.content: The Nature Reserve was{established {in 1965.}It extends north east to the River rother and west to the River Brede and Winchelsea Beach.Its southern boundary is the sea. { }It covers an{area of 1792 acres.} There is an information centre at Rye Harbour.Quite a lot of the area is{ {water and gravel pits.}The reserve covers{shingle ridges,}a large area of {grazing land}around Camber Castle and some {salt marsh}on the west bank of the River Rother between Rye Harbour and the river mouth. {The Friends of Rye Harbour Nature {Reserve}was formed{in 1973}to raise funds for the upkeep of the reserve. Recently many ladies from the village made a rather unusual quilt.Each of the 50 helpers contributed their own nature picture and then the squares were joined to make a bed cover.
